com.example.mobilibrary

Class MyBooksFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      • com.example.mobilibrary.MyBooksFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner

    public class MyBooksFragment
extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
    Author:
    Nguyen, Sooraj, Kimberly; My Books fragment that is navigated to using notification bar. Contains a dropdown that organizes the User's books into status: Owned, Requested, Accepted, and Borrowed. The user is able to see book title, author, isbn, and status. The user is also able to add and edit their books opened from this Fragment

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      android.view.View onCreateView(android.view.LayoutInflater inflater, android.view.ViewGroup container, android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState) 
      void updateBookList()
      Used to fill bookList with firestore items, will get the information from the current User Call back and use it to instantiate a new book object from the firestore information and add it to the bookList (clears it in case we have new items and want to count them) and updates adapter.

        Overrides:

      • updateBookList

        public void updateBookList()
        Used to fill bookList with firestore items, will get the information from the current User Call back and use it to instantiate a new book object from the firestore information and add it to the bookList (clears it in case we have new items and want to count them) and updates adapter. As well as added a spinned functions (which lets you filter your books based on status)
